did.abstract: Biographical and personal materials about the president of Sinclair Refining Company.

bioghist.head: Biography of William Henry Isom
bioghist.p: William Henry Isom (1859-1929) was president of Sinclair Refining Company. He went to work for Michael Cudahy as manager of the North American Transportation and Trading Company in the 1890s. He was made president of Cudahy Refining Company in 1908. In 1916 the company was acquired by H.F. Sinclair and renamed Sinclair Refining Company. Isom retained the presidency until his death in 1929.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes biographical materials about William Henry Isom, including a narrative by his son Langley W. Isom and a letter from James R. Murray; genealogical information; and photographs of Isom family members and of the launching of the Sinclair oil tanker “William Isom.”
